content.text:
## Context

Arguments: context: I need to respond to the survey. But it seems it expired, therefore apologize for the delay. I'm indeed dealing with an international move from USA to Brazil.
Arguments is a raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin or an additional context from the user.

## Task

Your task is to update 1 file in the @job-hunting/history directory

### Steps

1. Parse the arguments to extract the desired information
2. analyze the arguments to determine the best template to use or if it is just additional context
3. analyze the arguments to extract non-obvious information, like the datetime of the message and company name, etc.
4. With the provided information identify the the filename of the history file to update.
4. Update the history file

### Arguments Parsing

You should parse the arguments to extract the following information:

* The company name, either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiting company name (for contract positions), either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiter's name
* The date and time of the message, if it is only a day of the week or a hours ago calculate the datetime it was received.
  Note that it is always presented in the -07:00 timezone, unless explicitly stated otherwise.
* Subject of the message (if available)
* The message body

#### Input format

Below are texts written in mixed of regex and text., like a regex using python's f-string format for variables.
If multiple messages arrived, they are separated by a triple dash `\n---\n`.
It comes in one of the following formats:

##### Format 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that, sometimes, the person includes their company in their title, like "Talent Partner@ Amazon Robotics".
* In that case, you should extract the company name from the title.
* Gender pronouns are optional
* "\nVerified recruiter" is optional
* ", #HIRING" is optional
* "\nüëè\nüëç\nüòä\n+" is optional
* "{{subject}}\n" is optional
* "\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{full_name}}(\n\({{gender_pronouns}}\))?\n{{degree_connection}} degree connection\n¬∑ {{degree_connection}}\n{{person_title}}\n(\nVerified recruiter)?\n{{day_of_week_or_date}}\n{{full_name}} sent the following messages at {{time}}\nView {{first_name}}‚Äôs profile{{full_name}}(, #HIRING)?\n{{full_name}}( \({{gender_pronouns}}\))?  {{time}}(\nüëè\nüëç\nüòä\n+)?\n+({{subject}}\n)?{{message_body}}(\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload)?
```

##### Format 2 - Email

* "{{labels_names}}" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{subject}}\n({{labels_names}})?\n\n{{from}} <{{email_address}}>\n{{datetime_info}}\nto {{Jo√£o}}\n\n{{message_body}}
```

### History File

Create a new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.

#### History File Filename

The filename should be in the format of `<company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>.yaml` for full time positions
or `<recruiting_company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>-<company_name>.yaml` for contract positions.

If either the company name or the recruiting company name is unknown, use the word `unknown` in its place.

#### History File added or updated Content

The generated content should follow one of the templates below:

##### Template Group 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that `optional_subject` is optional
* `timestamp` should be printed in ISO format with the day of the week after it, e.g., `2025-08-20T15:21:00-07:00 Wednesday`
* Datetimes are always in -07:00 timezone

###### Template Group 1.1 - Reach-Out for contract positions

####### Template 1.1.1 - Without company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 1.1.2 - With company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.2 - Reach-out for Full Time positions

####### Template 1.2.1 - Without company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

####### Template 1.2.2 - With company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.3 - Response to LinkedIn Applications

####### Template 1.3.1 - Response to LinkedIn Application

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

##### Template Group 2 - Email

###### Template 2.1 - Recruiter Reach-Out for contract positions

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.2 - Recruiter Reach-Out for full time positions

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.3 - Application Response

####### Template 2.3.1 - Response to Email Application

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

#### Template Group 3 - Additional Context

```yaml
context:
  - {{context}}
```

#### Template Group 4 - Update Process Status

```yaml
process_status: {{process_status}}
```
I'll help you update the conversation history file with this additional context about the international move.

     9‚Üí    # Grupo QuintoAndar | Senior Software Engineer
    10‚Üí    Remote | Product and technology, Engineering | Full time
    11‚Üí    Brazil
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí    ## Overview
    14‚Üí    ### Description
    15‚Üí    #### About Grupo QuintoAndar
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí    Grupo QuintoAndar is the most valuable real estate tech company in Latin America, it was born in Brazil to do something very rewarding: open doors. We opened doors for technology to be part of living. And, through it, we reduce the bureaucracy and simplify the experience of the whole real estate ecosystem, including those renting, buying, and selling homes, as well as real estate brokers, agencies, and other partners of the real estate market.
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí    Together, our leading brands offer solutions covering all stages of the housing journey, namely: Immuebles24 (Mexico), Zonaprop (Argentina), Adondevivier & Urbania (Peru), Plusvalia (Ecuador), ImovelWeb and QuintoAndar (Brazil)
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí    Backed by a world-class team of investors and advisors, such as Kaszek, Qualcomm, General Atlantic, and SoftBank, QuintoAndar Group is currently valued at over $5.1 billion and continues to grow year-over-year. 
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí    To make all this happen, we have more than 3,500 talented people, working with cutting-edge technology and the best design practices to ensure a seamless experience throughout the sales and rental process, combined with smart financial products. Here you will work with the best professionals in the market, in an environment that breathes innovation, collaboration, and high performance.
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí    To learn more about our history, visit https://grupoquintoandar.com
    26‚Üí
    27‚Üí    #### About Grupo QuintoAndar:
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí    We are Grupo QuintoAndar, the largest real estate ecosystem in Latin America. Guided by a shared purpose of helping people love where they live, we have a diverse portfolio of brands and solutions that cover all stages of the journey of living. We develop technologies and innovations that transform and leverage the whole living experience.
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí    #### About working at QuintoAndar:
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí    * Possibility of learning;
    34‚Üí    * Opportunity to work in a team that seeks to use the best practices and tools in the market;
    35‚Üí    * Work in an informal environment with a horizontal structure;
    36‚Üí    * Being part of a team working on a high-impact project that affects the lives of thousands of people.
    37‚Üí
    38‚Üí    #### Location & Remote Work
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí    Our technology team works on the "remote-first" model, which means we are working from home with the possibility of living anywhere in Brazil. We also have the option of using QuintoAndar's offices in S√£o Paulo and Campinas or using partner coworking spaces, both up to twice a week.
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí    #### Language
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí    This job description is written in English because for that position you will need it for communications with coworkers and suppliers who are from worldwide, for tools and internal materials as well. // A descri√ß√£o desta vaga est√° escrita em Ingl√™s porque para esta posi√ß√£o √© necess√°rio para a comunica√ß√£o com colegas e fornecedores, que s√£o de diferentes pa√≠ses, al√©m do uso de ferramentas e materiais internos.
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí    #### Stages of the Selection Process
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí    Our selection process currently lasts an average of 30-40 days, from application to completion of the assessment. Going through:
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí    * Application
    51‚Üí    * Technical CV screening
    52‚Üí    * Interview with Recruiters
    53‚Üí    * Tech Screening with Engineering Team (live case)
    54‚Üí    * Technicals Interviews (code and architecture live cases)
    55‚Üí    * Offer
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí    #### About the Area:
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí    These are the Senior Software Engineer responsibilities at QuintoAndar:
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí    * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve complex software issues. Be part of the decision-making process for the evolution of our product and business;
    62‚Üí    * Work with Agile methodologies and participate in ceremonies to contribute to team process improvements;
    63‚Üí    * Be responsible for the entire software development lifecycle: definition, development, testing, production, and maintenance;
    64‚Üí    * Be a guardian of your team's delivery quality by reinforcing the adoption of good software development practices, and proposing improvements to our processes; participate in code reviews and design reviews;
    65‚Üí    * Succeed in a wide range of complex situations across multiple axes (scale, resilience, fault tolerance, etc.);
    66‚Üí    * Handle incidents, troubleshoot, and debug software issues with a learning mindset. Create post mortems and take actions to avoid similar incidents in the future;
    67‚Üí    * Implement and maintain scalable and reliable software architecture, as well as design patterns;
    68‚Üí    * Actively improve the way we build software and pave the road to solve new challenges;
    69‚Üí    * Mentor a team of software engineers, providing technical guidance and support;
    70‚Üí    * Participate in code reviews and ensure high code quality.
    71‚Üí
    72‚Üí    #### Seniority Level:
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí    We want to have as many talented people as possible in our team. So, although this position is described as ‚ÄúSenior Software Engineer‚Äù, you can apply even if you don‚Äôt consider yourself as a senior professional yet. It‚Äôs important to us to create a qualified talent poll and we will definitely reach out to you if we think you can add to our teams, no matter what seniority level you are today.
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí    ### Requirements
    77‚Üí
    78‚Üí    #### What we are looking for:
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí    * Proven experience with Agile development practices, including Scrum or Kanban;
    81‚Üí    * Proficient in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Kotlin, or JavaScript;
    82‚Üí    * Strong understanding of database design and evolution;
    83‚Üí    * Experience designing and evolving software architecture from the ground up;
    84‚Üí    * Skilled in creating RESTful APIs;
    85‚Üí    * Experience with tools and practices for software monitoring, observability, and performance tracking;
    86‚Üí    * Solid software engineering fundamentals, including version control, testing, and deployment automation, code reviews, design documentation;
    87‚Üí    * Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail; people that are seeking to learn and deliver real impact through high-quality data-driven and structured software, valuing work-life balance;
    88‚Üí    * Fluency in Portuguese and advanced English - we usually use English to write our code, documentation, tools, reference materials and eventually talk to partners and co-workers from other countries.
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí    #### You'll stand out if you:
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí    * Has experience mentoring a team of software engineers;
    93‚Üí    * Already developed scalable client-server mobile applications;
    94‚Üí    * Have experience with cloud service platforms and its services (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc);
    95‚Üí    * Understand how modern CD/CI works;
    96‚Üí    * Have some knowledge on containers and container-orchestration (eg. Kubernetes);
    97‚Üí    * Know how to test and tune scalability;
    98‚Üí    * Know computer theory, including optimization of algorithms and distributed systems;
    99‚Üí    * Understand the work is never done; we are always taking care and evolving our services.
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí    #### Important:
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí    * Our selection process starts with the application! If you are truly interested in joining our team, make sure to put in extra effort at this stage. We review all candidates individually and provide feedback even to those who do not proceed in the process;
   104‚Üí    * All communication is done via email, so be attentive to our messages and whitelist the @quintoandar.com.br domain to prevent our emails from going to spam.
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí    ### Benefits
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí    * Competitive salary package;
   109‚Üí    * Bonus;
   110‚Üí    * Meal allowance ("Flash Benef√≠cios");
   111‚Üí    * Health plan;

   116‚Üí    * Parental leave;
   117‚Üí    * Educational discounts.
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí    #### Diversity & Inclusion at QuintoAndar
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí    At QuintoAndar, we believe diversity of perspectives and experiences guarantee a differentiated work environment, based on respect and valuing differences. Feel free to declare the information on the registration form. If you are not comfortable answering them, just choose the option "I prefer not to respond". This information helps us create an increasingly inclusive environment and it is used only for this purpose, it is confidential, and it will not impact your performance throughout the hiring process

    # Grupo QuintoAndar | Senior Software Engineer
    Remote | Product and technology, Engineering | Full time
    Brazil

    ## Overview
    ### Description
    #### About Grupo QuintoAndar

    Grupo QuintoAndar is the most valuable real estate tech company in Latin America, it was born in Brazil to do something very rewarding: open doors. We opened doors for technology to be part of living. And, through it, we reduce the bureaucracy and simplify the experience of the whole real estate ecosystem, including those renting, buying, and selling homes, as well as real estate brokers, agencies, and other partners of the real estate market.

    Together, our leading brands offer solutions covering all stages of the housing journey, namely: Immuebles24 (Mexico), Zonaprop (Argentina), Adondevivier & Urbania (Peru), Plusvalia (Ecuador), ImovelWeb and QuintoAndar (Brazil)

    Backed by a world-class team of investors and advisors, such as Kaszek, Qualcomm, General Atlantic, and SoftBank, QuintoAndar Group is currently valued at over $5.1 billion and continues to grow year-over-year. 

    To make all this happen, we have more than 3,500 talented people, working with cutting-edge technology and the best design practices to ensure a seamless experience throughout the sales and rental process, combined with smart financial products. Here you will work with the best professionals in the market, in an environment that breathes innovation, collaboration, and high performance.

    To learn more about our history, visit https://grupoquintoandar.com

    #### About Grupo QuintoAndar:

    We are Grupo QuintoAndar, the largest real estate ecosystem in Latin America. Guided by a shared purpose of helping people love where they live, we have a diverse portfolio of brands and solutions that cover all stages of the journey of living. We develop technologies and innovations that transform and leverage the whole living experience.

    #### About working at QuintoAndar:

    * Possibility of learning;
    * Opportunity to work in a team that seeks to use the best practices and tools in the market;
    * Work in an informal environment with a horizontal structure;
    * Being part of a team working on a high-impact project that affects the lives of thousands of people.

    #### Location & Remote Work

    Our technology team works on the "remote-first" model, which means we are working from home with the possibility of living anywhere in Brazil. We also have the option of using QuintoAndar's offices in S√£o Paulo and Campinas or using partner coworking spaces, both up to twice a week.

    #### Language

    This job description is written in English because for that position you will need it for communications with coworkers and suppliers who are from worldwide, for tools and internal materials as well. // A descri√ß√£o desta vaga est√° escrita em Ingl√™s porque para esta posi√ß√£o √© necess√°rio para a comunica√ß√£o com colegas e fornecedores, que s√£o de diferentes pa√≠ses, al√©m do uso de ferramentas e materiais internos.

    #### Stages of the Selection Process

    Our selection process currently lasts an average of 30-40 days, from application to completion of the assessment. Going through:

    * Application
    * Technical CV screening
    * Interview with Recruiters
    * Tech Screening with Engineering Team (live case)
    * Technicals Interviews (code and architecture live cases)
    * Offer

    #### About the Area:

    These are the Senior Software Engineer responsibilities at QuintoAndar:

    * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve complex software issues. Be part of the decision-making process for the evolution of our product and business;
    * Work with Agile methodologies and participate in ceremonies to contribute to team process improvements;
    * Be responsible for the entire software development lifecycle: definition, development, testing, production, and maintenance;
    * Be a guardian of your team's delivery quality by reinforcing the adoption of good software development practices, and proposing improvements to our processes; participate in code reviews and design reviews;
    * Succeed in a wide range of complex situations across multiple axes (scale, resilience, fault tolerance, etc.);
    * Handle incidents, troubleshoot, and debug software issues with a learning mindset. Create post mortems and take actions to avoid similar incidents in the future;
    * Implement and maintain scalable and reliable software architecture, as well as design patterns;
    * Actively improve the way we build software and pave the road to solve new challenges;
    * Mentor a team of software engineers, providing technical guidance and support;
    * Participate in code reviews and ensure high code quality.

    #### Seniority Level:

    We want to have as many talented people as possible in our team. So, although this position is described as ‚ÄúSenior Software Engineer‚Äù, you can apply even if you don‚Äôt consider yourself as a senior professional yet. It‚Äôs important to us to create a qualified talent poll and we will definitely reach out to you if we think you can add to our teams, no matter what seniority level you are today.

    ### Requirements

    #### What we are looking for:

    * Proven experience with Agile development practices, including Scrum or Kanban;
    * Proficient in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Kotlin, or JavaScript;
    * Strong understanding of database design and evolution;
    * Experience designing and evolving software architecture from the ground up;
    * Skilled in creating RESTful APIs;
    * Experience with tools and practices for software monitoring, observability, and performance tracking;
    * Solid software engineering fundamentals, including version control, testing, and deployment automation, code reviews, design documentation;
    * Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail; people that are seeking to learn and deliver real impact through high-quality data-driven and structured software, valuing work-life balance;
    * Fluency in Portuguese and advanced English - we usually use English to write our code, documentation, tools, reference materials and eventually talk to partners and co-workers from other countries.

    #### You'll stand out if you:

    * Has experience mentoring a team of software engineers;
    * Already developed scalable client-server mobile applications;
    * Have experience with cloud service platforms and its services (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc);
    * Understand how modern CD/CI works;
    * Have some knowledge on containers and container-orchestration (eg. Kubernetes);
    * Know how to test and tune scalability;
    * Know computer theory, including optimization of algorithms and distributed systems;
    * Understand the work is never done; we are always taking care and evolving our services.

    #### Important:

    * Our selection process starts with the application! If you are truly interested in joining our team, make sure to put in extra effort at this stage. We review all candidates individually and provide feedback even to those who do not proceed in the process;
    * All communication is done via email, so be attentive to our messages and whitelist the @quintoandar.com.br domain to prevent our emails from going to spam.

    ### Benefits

    * Competitive salary package;
    * Bonus;
    * Meal allowance ("Flash Benef√≠cios");
    * Health plan;
    * Dental plan (optional);
    * Life insurance;
    * Daycare subsidy;
    * Subsidy to sports practicing (Gympass).
    * Parental leave;
    * Educational discounts.

    #### Diversity & Inclusion at QuintoAndar

    At QuintoAndar, we believe diversity of perspectives and experiences guarantee a differentiated work environment, based on respect and valuing differences. Feel free to declare the information on the registration form. If you are not comfortable answering them, just choose the option "I prefer not to respond". This information helps us create an increasingly inclusive environment and it is used only for this purpose, it is confidential, and it will not impact your performance throughout the hiring process

    #### Data Protection Policy

    The information you provide in the recruitment process form is confidential and stored in a secure environment. We have implemented technical and administrative measures to protect your data. To learn more about how we handle personal data, please visit our .
    To exercise your rights regarding your personal data, such as access to data, confirmation of processing, correction of data, anonymization, blocking or deletion, and other rights with the QuintoAndar Group, please contact us through our .

    14‚Üí      We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, comfortable in a ‚Äútake the initiative‚Äù environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.

    32‚Üí      * Plus: experience being a technical reference for more junior colleagues.

    53‚Üí      We're looking for a talented and passionate Senior Data Engineer to join Wildlife's Marketing Tech team in S√£o Paulo, Brazil.

    55‚Üí      Wildlife is one of the largest gaming companies in the world. Besides building amazing games, part of the reason it has been super successful has been its ability to acquire new users more efficiently than other companies. As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll play a key role in our Performance Marketing operations by handling data from millions of users, thousands of campaigns, and dozens of different channels, helping us to solve our most challenging quests. Some of them are:

  - link: https://careers.wildlifestudios.com/jobs/senior-game-engineer-8160562002/
    content: |
      # Senior Game Engineer
      S√£o Paulo - Hybrid

      We're looking for a talented and passionate Game Engineer, to join Wildlife's Live Games Tech Team working from Sao Paulo.

      As a game engineer, you will work on the maintenance of released games, with millions of daily players. You will be involved in activities required to keep the apps alive as well as implementing new features to enhance player experience.

      We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, comfortable in a ‚Äútake the initiative‚Äù environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business. 

      ## What you'll do
      * Work on live games with millions of active players.
      * Implement and test business logic on games and services.
      * Perform maintenance and updates to keep the game running live.
      * Ship new versions to production, supervise metrics and user feedback after the release.
      * Provide timely transparency of development status and risks to interested parties.
      * You will help to solve the most challenging technical issues in the game, partnering with team members to solve them.
      * Work in an agile environment.

      ## What you'll need
      * Experience developing mobile apps or games.
      * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience.
      * Working proficiency in English (all documents and some meetings are in English).
      * Plus: you have published apps/games in the mobile app stores.
      * Plus: experience with C++, Objective C, Java for Android, OpenGL, C#, Unity.
      * Plus: experience with backend (JavaScript, Node, GoLang, and Kubernetes).
      * Plus: experience being a technical reference for more junior colleagues.
      
      ## More about you
      * You are motivated to work on games that have millions of players.
      * You feel comfortable navigating on large projects and investigating the code to understand how things work.
      * You like to learn different technologies.
      * You are proactive, understand overall goals, and work towards them autonomously.
      * You can communicate clearly with your team.
      
      ## About Wildlife
      Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Here, we create and maintain games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!

      ## Equal Opportunity
      Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

      We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.
  - link: https://careers.wildlifestudios.com/jobs/senior-data-engineer-7937483002/
    content: |
      # Senior Data Engineer
      S√£o Paulo - Hybrid

      We're looking for a talented and passionate Senior Data Engineer to join Wildlife's Marketing Tech team in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. 

      Wildlife is one of the largest gaming companies in the world. Besides building amazing games, part of the reason it has been super successful has been its ability to acquire new users more efficiently than other companies. As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll play a key role in our Performance Marketing operations by handling data from millions of users, thousands of campaigns, and dozens of different channels, helping us to solve our most challenging quests. Some of them are:

      * Evolve integrations with several third-party APIs including Ad Networks, MMPs, and other data providers
      * Attribute the users to the marketing campaigns that drove their financial impact;
      * Estimate the lifetime value of our users to measure the long-term return on our Marketing investments;
      * Build the capabilities to run experiments to continuously improve the performance of our creative assets and our Marketing operations;
      * Support the decision-making of our Marketing operations through high-quality data products and well-structured dashboards;

      We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is naturally curious, comfortable in a ‚Äútake the initiative‚Äù environment, loves solving problems, is resilient, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.

      ## What you'll do

      * Solve complex and open-ended problems that directly impact one of the most critical areas of the company;
      * Help to evolve and improve the performance of our current solutions and build new data products and systems
      * Be part of a cross-functional team, directly contributing end-to-end to our processes, making sure our products are in production and working properly (final impact);
      * Work in a challenging and fun environment to produce exceptional results.

      ## What you'll need

      * Experience working on designing and developing data-intensive applications in the cloud with technologies such as Spark, SQL, Python, Airflow, etc
      * Excellent high-level communication skills
      * Proficiency in written English
      
      ## Main Challenges

      * The team is responsible for designing, building, and evolving a big set of complex data-intensive applications including batch data apps, near real-time data ingestion, ML models, and BI pipelines
      * These applications also require the team to build, maintain, and evolve integrations with several third-party APIs including Ad Networks, MMPs, and other data providers used in Digital Marketing
      * As a Senior Data Engineer, you will help the team to ensure high availability, reliability, robustness, performance, cost-effectiveness, and maintainability of the developed solutions
      * We have a multidisciplinary environment and you will interact with people from diverse backgrounds, including Game Engineers, Backend Engineers, Data Scientists, and Product Marketing Managers.

      ## More about you

      * You are impact-driven and interested in learning more about adjacent disciplines (e.g.: Backend, Data Science, etc);
      * You like to solve open-ended problems with non-obvious solutions;
      * You communicate in a structured way both speaking and writing, including in English;
      * You are an excellent teammate and raise the bar of those around you.

      ## About Wildlife

      Wildlife is one of the world's leading mobile game developers and publishers. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!

      ## Equal Opportunity

      Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

    content: |
      # Senior Backend Engineer - Python
      S√£o Paulo - Remote

      We're looking for a talented and passionate Senior Software Engineer to join Wildlife's Cloud Economics team in S√£o Paulo (Brazil).

      As a Senior Software Engineer you will be responsible for producing the algorithms, models and automated tools needed to scale up the optimizing and alerting processes for Infra usage and costs. This person will also design and build intra-area solutions throughout the Operations department to reduce manual tasks and increase efficiency.

      We know that the work we do has a high impact on our company's success and culture. The right person for this position is curious by nature, and comfortable in a ‚Äútake the initiative‚Äù environment, loves solving problems, and can thrive in a fast and growing business.

      ## What you'll do
      * Be part of a high-output team, directly contributing to company results.
      * Work closely with stakeholders to devise solutions that meet business and technical expectations.
      * Design, develop, and maintain custom tools and software solutions to capture efficiencies in the usage of our technological resources (e.g. rightsizing models, anomaly detection systems).
      * Integrate various support tools, databases, and platforms to ensure seamless data flow and information accessibility for Telemetry projects.
      * Identify opportunities for automation within our processes and implement solutions that increase efficiency and accuracy.
      * Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all tools, processes, and workflows to facilitate knowledge sharing.

      ## What you'll need
      * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
      * Solid experience in software development and solution design.
      * Excellent analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
      * Solid experience with at least Python and SQL
      * Experience in designing, implementing and monitoring distributed systems.
      * Experience with large scale services handling high volume of requests or data.
      * Experience with cloud computing services such as AWS.
      * Experience with API integrations.
      * Intermediate / Advanced level of English.
      
      ## More about you
      * You are a resourceful person with a go-getter attitude.
      * You are flexible, thriving in radically changing environments.
      * You are not afraid to propose and explore new initiatives.
      * You are a determined and metrics oriented engineer who wants to deliver results.
      * You are passionate about working on and solving problems.
      * You are a team player. You're willing to help out wherever needed.
      
      ### Plus:

      * Experience with frontend development.
      * Experience developing platform products.
      * Business knowledge about the games industry.
      
      ## About Wildlife
      Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles! Here, we create games that will be treasured by billions of players worldwide.

      ## Equal Opportunity
      Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

      We're committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

  - |
    # Software Engineer II, Backend - Core Services
    Backend, Engineering in Sao Paulo, Brazil

    **Apply Now**

    ### About the Team

    Core Services Engineering develops and manages the commerce platform that power all Uber apps. Operating across 70+ countries and processing millions of transactions per second, the team works to meet the evolving needs of Uber's current and future business.

    ### About the Role

    Software Engineers at Uber have an impact across a variety of business and technology decisions spanning projects and locations. We are passionate and pragmatic technologists who are able to design scalable systems while deliver efficient code. We are humble teachers, technically mentoring a team of talented engineers while also executing on delivering uniquely ambitious projects! As a Software Engineer on the Engineering team in Brazil, you will be an member of Uber's development center in LATAM, developing products across Uber and all around the World.

    ### What You'll Do:

    * Design and develop scalable backend systems
    * Build large scale systems working worldwide
    * Work closely with multiple stakeholders to enable experiences globally

    ### Minimum qualifications

    * Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field AND/ OR +3-year total technical software engineering experience;
    * Programming language (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python, or Go);
    * Advanced English language skills to work with other engineers and stakeholders from different regions around the world.

    ### Technical skills:

    * Product engineering
    * Scalability engineering
    * Distributed systems

    **Please note: this hybrid position is based in S√£o Paulo, Brazil - welcoming both local professionals and those open to relocating to S√£o Paulo.**

    Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuelds progress. What moves us, moves the world - let‚Äôs move it forward, together.

    Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber‚Äôs cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.

    \*Accommodations may be available based on religious and/or medical conditions, or as required by applicable law. To request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@uber.com.

job_descriptions:
  - |
    # Grupo QuintoAndar | Senior Software Engineer
    Remote | Product and technology, Engineering | Full time
    Brazil

    ## Overview
    ### Description
    #### About Grupo QuintoAndar

    Grupo QuintoAndar is the most valuable real estate tech company in Latin America, it was born in Brazil to do something very rewarding: open doors. We opened doors for technology to be part of living. And, through it, we reduce the bureaucracy and simplify the experience of the whole real estate ecosystem, including those renting, buying, and selling homes, as well as real estate brokers, agencies, and other partners of the real estate market.

    Together, our leading brands offer solutions covering all stages of the housing journey, namely: Immuebles24 (Mexico), Zonaprop (Argentina), Adondevivier & Urbania (Peru), Plusvalia (Ecuador), ImovelWeb and QuintoAndar (Brazil)

    Backed by a world-class team of investors and advisors, such as Kaszek, Qualcomm, General Atlantic, and SoftBank, QuintoAndar Group is currently valued at over $5.1 billion and continues to grow year-over-year. 

    To make all this happen, we have more than 3,500 talented people, working with cutting-edge technology and the best design practices to ensure a seamless experience throughout the sales and rental process, combined with smart financial products. Here you will work with the best professionals in the market, in an environment that breathes innovation, collaboration, and high performance.

    To learn more about our history, visit https://grupoquintoandar.com

    #### About Grupo QuintoAndar:

    We are Grupo QuintoAndar, the largest real estate ecosystem in Latin America. Guided by a shared purpose of helping people love where they live, we have a diverse portfolio of brands and solutions that cover all stages of the journey of living. We develop technologies and innovations that transform and leverage the whole living experience.

    #### About working at QuintoAndar:

    * Possibility of learning;
    * Opportunity to work in a team that seeks to use the best practices and tools in the market;
    * Work in an informal environment with a horizontal structure;
    * Being part of a team working on a high-impact project that affects the lives of thousands of people.

    #### Location & Remote Work

    Our technology team works on the "remote-first" model, which means we are working from home with the possibility of living anywhere in Brazil. We also have the option of using QuintoAndar's offices in S√£o Paulo and Campinas or using partner coworking spaces, both up to twice a week.

    #### Language

    This job description is written in English because for that position you will need it for communications with coworkers and suppliers who are from worldwide, for tools and internal materials as well. // A descri√ß√£o desta vaga est√° escrita em Ingl√™s porque para esta posi√ß√£o √© necess√°rio para a comunica√ß√£o com colegas e fornecedores, que s√£o de diferentes pa√≠ses, al√©m do uso de ferramentas e materiais internos.

    #### Stages of the Selection Process

    Our selection process currently lasts an average of 30-40 days, from application to completion of the assessment. Going through:

    * Application
    * Technical CV screening
    * Interview with Recruiters
    * Tech Screening with Engineering Team (live case)
    * Technicals Interviews (code and architecture live cases)
    * Offer

    #### About the Area:

    These are the Senior Software Engineer responsibilities at QuintoAndar:

    * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve complex software issues. Be part of the decision-making process for the evolution of our product and business;
    * Work with Agile methodologies and participate in ceremonies to contribute to team process improvements;
    * Be responsible for the entire software development lifecycle: definition, development, testing, production, and maintenance;
    * Be a guardian of your team's delivery quality by reinforcing the adoption of good software development practices, and proposing improvements to our processes; participate in code reviews and design reviews;
    * Succeed in a wide range of complex situations across multiple axes (scale, resilience, fault tolerance, etc.);
    * Handle incidents, troubleshoot, and debug software issues with a learning mindset. Create post mortems and take actions to avoid similar incidents in the future;
    * Implement and maintain scalable and reliable software architecture, as well as design patterns;
    * Actively improve the way we build software and pave the road to solve new challenges;
    * Mentor a team of software engineers, providing technical guidance and support;
    * Participate in code reviews and ensure high code quality.

    #### Seniority Level:

    We want to have as many talented people as possible in our team. So, although this position is described as ‚ÄúSenior Software Engineer‚Äù, you can apply even if you don‚Äôt consider yourself as a senior professional yet. It‚Äôs important to us to create a qualified talent poll and we will definitely reach out to you if we think you can add to our teams, no matter what seniority level you are today.

    ### Requirements

    #### What we are looking for:

    * Proven experience with Agile development practices, including Scrum or Kanban;
    * Proficient in one or more programming languages, such as Java, Kotlin, or JavaScript;
    * Strong understanding of database design and evolution;
    * Experience designing and evolving software architecture from the ground up;
    * Skilled in creating RESTful APIs;
    * Experience with tools and practices for software monitoring, observability, and performance tracking;
    * Solid software engineering fundamentals, including version control, testing, and deployment automation, code reviews, design documentation;
    * Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail; people that are seeking to learn and deliver real impact through high-quality data-driven and structured software, valuing work-life balance;
    * Fluency in Portuguese and advanced English - we usually use English to write our code, documentation, tools, reference materials and eventually talk to partners and co-workers from other countries.

    #### You'll stand out if you:

    * Has experience mentoring a team of software engineers;
    * Already developed scalable client-server mobile applications;
    * Have experience with cloud service platforms and its services (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc);
    * Understand how modern CD/CI works;
    * Have some knowledge on containers and container-orchestration (eg. Kubernetes);
    * Know how to test and tune scalability;
    * Know computer theory, including optimization of algorithms and distributed systems;
    * Understand the work is never done; we are always taking care and evolving our services.

    #### Important:

    * Our selection process starts with the application! If you are truly interested in joining our team, make sure to put in extra effort at this stage. We review all candidates individually and provide feedback even to those who do not proceed in the process;
    * All communication is done via email, so be attentive to our messages and whitelist the @quintoandar.com.br domain to prevent our emails from going to spam.

    ### Benefits

    * Competitive salary package;
    * Bonus;
    * Meal allowance ("Flash Benef√≠cios");
    * Health plan;
    * Dental plan (optional);
    * Life insurance;
    * Daycare subsidy;
    * Subsidy to sports practicing (Gympass).
    * Parental leave;
    * Educational discounts.

    #### Diversity & Inclusion at QuintoAndar

    At QuintoAndar, we believe diversity of perspectives and experiences guarantee a differentiated work environment, based on respect and valuing differences. Feel free to declare the information on the registration form. If you are not comfortable answering them, just choose the option "I prefer not to respond". This information helps us create an increasingly inclusive environment and it is used only for this purpose, it is confidential, and it will not impact your performance throughout the hiring process

    #### Data Protection Policy

    The information you provide in the recruitment process form is confidential and stored in a secure environment. We have implemented technical and administrative measures to protect your data. To learn more about how we handle personal data, please visit our .
    To exercise your rights regarding your personal data, such as access to data, confirmation of processing, correction of data, anonymization, blocking or deletion, and other rights with the QuintoAndar Group, please contact us through our .

    #LI-RJ1

content.text:
## Context

Arguments: context: I need to respond to the survey. But it seems it expired, therefore apologize for the delay. I'm indeed dealing with an international move from USA to Brazil.
file: @job-hunting/history/quintoandar-rebeca.yaml
Arguments is a raw text copy-pasted from either email or linkedin or an additional context from the user.

## Task

Your task is to update 1 file in the @job-hunting/history directory

### Steps

1. Parse the arguments to extract the desired information
2. analyze the arguments to determine the best template to use or if it is just additional context
3. analyze the arguments to extract non-obvious information, like the datetime of the message and company name, etc.
4. With the provided information identify the the filename of the history file to update.
4. Update the history file

### Arguments Parsing

You should parse the arguments to extract the following information:

* The company name, either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiting company name (for contract positions), either from the person's title or from the message body
* The recruiter's name
* The date and time of the message, if it is only a day of the week or a hours ago calculate the datetime it was received.
  Note that it is always presented in the -07:00 timezone, unless explicitly stated otherwise.
* Subject of the message (if available)
* The message body

#### Input format

Below are texts written in mixed of regex and text., like a regex using python's f-string format for variables.
If multiple messages arrived, they are separated by a triple dash `\n---\n`.
It comes in one of the following formats:

##### Format 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that, sometimes, the person includes their company in their title, like "Talent Partner@ Amazon Robotics".
* In that case, you should extract the company name from the title.
* Gender pronouns are optional
* "\nVerified recruiter" is optional
* ", #HIRING" is optional
* "\nüëè\nüëç\nüòä\n+" is optional
* "{{subject}}\n" is optional
* "\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{full_name}}(\n\({{gender_pronouns}}\))?\n{{degree_connection}} degree connection\n¬∑ {{degree_connection}}\n{{person_title}}\n(\nVerified recruiter)?\n{{day_of_week_or_date}}\n{{full_name}} sent the following messages at {{time}}\nView {{first_name}}‚Äôs profile{{full_name}}(, #HIRING)?\n{{full_name}}( \({{gender_pronouns}}\))?  {{time}}(\nüëè\nüëç\nüòä\n+)?\n+({{subject}}\n)?{{message_body}}(\n{2,}{{attachment_filename}}\n\n{{attachment_size}}\n\nDownload)?
```

##### Format 2 - Email

* "{{labels_names}}" is optional
* You should infer the desired variables from the text.

```text
{{subject}}\n({{labels_names}})?\n\n{{from}} <{{email_address}}>\n{{datetime_info}}\nto {{Jo√£o}}\n\n{{message_body}}
```

### History File

Create a new history file in the @job-hunting/history directory.

#### History File Filename

The filename should be in the format of `<company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>.yaml` for full time positions
or `<recruiting_company_name>-<recruiter_first_name>-<company_name>.yaml` for contract positions.

If either the company name or the recruiting company name is unknown, use the word `unknown` in its place.

#### History File added or updated Content

The generated content should follow one of the templates below:

##### Template Group 1 - LinkedIn

* Note that `optional_subject` is optional
* `timestamp` should be printed in ISO format with the day of the week after it, e.g., `2025-08-20T15:21:00-07:00 Wednesday`
* Datetimes are always in -07:00 timezone

###### Template Group 1.1 - Reach-Out for contract positions

####### Template 1.1.1 - Without company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 1.1.2 - With company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.2 - Reach-out for Full Time positions

####### Template 1.2.1 - Without company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

####### Template 1.2.2 - With company name

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{optional_subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template Group 1.3 - Response to LinkedIn Applications

####### Template 1.3.1 - Response to LinkedIn Application

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

##### Template Group 2 - Email

###### Template 2.1 - Recruiter Reach-Out for contract positions

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.2 - Recruiter Reach-Out for full time positions

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

###### Template 2.3 - Application Response

####### Template 2.3.1 - Response to Email Application

```yaml
  - timestamp: {{timestamp}}
    from: {{from}}
    subject: {{subject}}
    body: |
      {{message_body}}
```

#### Template Group 3 - Additional Context

```yaml
context:
  - {{context}}
```

#### Template Group 4 - Update Process Status

```yaml
process_status: {{process_status}}
```

The context has been added to the existing context section in [job-hunting/history/quintoandar-rebeca.yaml](job-hunting/history/quintoandar-rebeca.yaml#L1-L5), which now includes:

1. Your hard deadline to leave the US on October 29th
2. A reminder to ask about relocation package when appropriate
3. The scheduled call information from September 16th
4. **NEW**: Your note about needing to respond to the expired survey and apologizing for the delay due to the international move

This additional context will be useful when crafting your response to Rebeca's follow-up message about the satisfaction survey (from October 9th).
